How do I get a list of all confirmed transfers for a particular chain using the `getpendingtransfers` command?

The `getpendingtransfers` command actually returns all pending transfers for a particular chain that have not yet been aggregated into an export, not confirmed transfers. If you want to get a list of confirmed transfers, you would need to use a different command.

getpendingtransfers "chainname"

Returns all pending transfers for a particular chain that have not yet been aggregated into an export

Arguments
1. "chainname"           (string, optional) name of the chain to look for. no parameter returns current chain in daemon.

Result:
 {
 }

Examples:
> verus getpendingtransfers "chainname"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getpendingtransfers", "params": ["chainname"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
Can I use the `getpendingtransfers` command without specifying a chain name?

Yes, you can use the `getpendingtransfers` command without specifying a chain name. If you don't provide a chain name, the command will return the pending transfers for the current chain in the daemon.

getpendingtransfers "chainname"

Returns all pending transfers for a particular chain that have not yet been aggregated into an export

Arguments
1. "chainname"           (string, optional) name of the chain to look for. no parameter returns current chain in daemon.

Result:
 {
 }

Examples:
> verus getpendingtransfers "chainname"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getpendingtransfers", "params": ["chainname"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
